reviews.title: Not up to the 4* it supposedly has
reviews.text: Here on business for the week, these are my observations:

reviews.title: Not an airport hotel
reviews.text: - big hotel, great reception lobby area
- food is good but not extraordinary, limited choice in room service, but 3 restaurants
reviews.title: Renaissance Zurich Hotel

reviews.text: - rooms are large, with desk area offering adaptor facility which is great, as well as a dressing room, bathrooms are pretty small. No complimentary water in the rooms which for that level is appalling. Mini bar only contains one bottle of 75cl still water at this astronomical price of 6CHF, ie 4.94€. No slipper or bathrobes which I found in lower ranked hotels like the Swisshotel in Oerlikon. Might seem a detail but when you pay 245CHF the night you do expect the level of service that comes at the price.
reviews.title: Great place if your office is in Glatt Park Zurich

reviews.text: - at my arrival, 5.30pm in the afternoon, no room ready, I was asked to wait for 30' which I declined. They found me a room but it wasn't an upgrade, rather a downgrade. I had asked and repeated t reception I would ride a quiet room, far from elevator and stairs and the room they gave was right next to the elevator...
reviews.title: Convenience, class and comfort!!!

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night. It is very close to the airport - an easy 10 minute ride by tram and near to a growing array of international company head offices - which must be pretty much the only reason to stay here. It would appear to cater for conferences too. The lobby is glossy but the rooms don't reach the same standard although they are perfectly acceptable. The train line runs right behind the hotel so you can't have your window open unless you are at the front. They don't have minibars so if you want water or anything else they have a strange little shop are near to reception. You have to pay for wi-fi - a staggering 30 SF, and breakfast is a staggering 35 SF to eat mediocre fare in what feels like a canteen. This is on top of the cost of the room which was enormous as well. This may well be the going rate in Zurich, but to be paying the same price to stay in a dreary Zurich business park as you would pay to stay in downtown Manhattan is a little galling.
reviews.title: Glossy but average business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the hotel is a 20 minute tram ride from the city centre I think for the price it is worth the journey (and it is in the "inner-zone" so a 24 hour ZVV ticket doesn't break the bank).
reviews.title: Not quite a 5* hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were upgraded to a suite for the night, however the decor was old in style and I believe this hotel is having a refit in 2014 (definitely in need of it)
reviews.title: Kind of Isolated!
Better then expected
reviews.text: As you'd expect with a Marriott hotel, the bed is large and comfy and you get more than an average amount of little extras (bath salts, mouthwash, slippers, tea/coffee).

The reception area is nice and the staff very friendly. I was a little disappointed with the american breakfast. Only scrambled eggs, baked beans were on the hotplate too long so very dry and bread rolls choice limited. Their maple syrup was to die for though and there was an excellent selection of juice too.
reviews.title: As you would expect but in need of updating

reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Great food. Excellent Customer Service. Close to airport, but far enough to enjoy the town. Centrally located to many restuarants. It's not too far from iL Gallo Pizzeria Ristorante. This was also reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Excellent!!!!

reviews.text: It's so nice to be pleasantly surprised by a hotel. The level of service, quality of the Asian restaurant, the ambience of the bar area and the excellent array of breakfast were what you expect from a more leisure based, luxury hotel. Thoroughly recommend but search the comparison sites to get the best rate as they do offer good discounts at times.
reviews.title: Great value and unbelievably good breakfast

reviews.text: We had booked a room at chf 355 and were given one showing to the very busy railway. Breakfast was not even included! We also learned that the Hotel might beclosed by e nd of this year. So, probably they don't really care anymore and make cah-cowing. Its really a pity how some comnies in this service industry behave. Make more money mentality doesn't fit hospitality.
reviews.title: noisy room at horrendous price

reviews.text: We stayed at the Renaissance Zurich in February for 3 nights. The hotel lobby is very nice, rooms are very comfortable.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel near the airport

reviews.text: They have a great gym.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel. Great location. Very convenience

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel while visiting Zurich in January. I was worried about the location outside of the downtown city area, however the first night there we hopped on the tram and rode in to the city with no troubles at all. The hotel itself is a very nice property - the restaurants were wonderful and the club lounge was great. We were much happier here then I had originally thought we would be.
reviews.title: Great hotel and easy city access

reviews.text: The Renaissance Hotel is part of the Marriott Group and therefore its standard is definitely high. The common areas are posh, the rooms large and the service qualified. The breakfast buffet is worth a try - you can find everything you wish. The location is convenient if you need to stay close to the airport or if you are on a business trip since the block is close to an office area. The only drawback is its proximity to the rails and if your room is close to the railway you may hear some noise.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel not far from the airport

reviews.text: Our family enjoyed our one night stay at this property. The lobby is lovely. The rooms are okay - not fabulous, but, nothing really wrong with them. We ate dinner at the hotel and the food was very good. Service everywhere on property was top notch.
reviews.title: Easy access to airport and downtown. Spendy Internet/food

reviews.text: Internet (which has always been free for us in the Marriott chain) was quoted at $25 per day which is a little much, in my opinion.
reviews.title: Is this hotel worth the money? Definately not the breakfast buffet.

reviews.text: Love the access to town and airport with the trams.
reviews.title: Pleasant staff, handy for Messe, needs a refurb soon
